page.title: 13FIVE CHURCHES IN MONIFIETH
page.content:
{ St Rule or Regulus}is the Patron Saint of Monifieth and gives his name to the Parish Church.Rule,a friend of St Columba came to Monifieth from a settlement in St Andrews about 570.In 1977 1400 years of Christianity in the area was celebrated.All the churches contributed to a brochure.
{ St Rules}has stained glass windows by Burne-Jones and Morris,ancient silver Communion Cups and stone carvings from 7-13th century.The latter are in Edinburgh in the Antiquities Museum. At the Disruption the{South Church} and{Panmure Church}reformed.After the Reformation the Scottish Episcopalians also formed.They meet in{Holy Trinity} { St Bride's}is the Catholic Church.On Wednesday 1st February 1984 a new building was dedicated.The old church is used as a hall.
